t: Then*p Jonah prayed to the Lord*s his God from the stomach of the fish,
and he said, “I*pn called out of my distress to the Lord,*s And*ln He answered me. I*ln cried for help from the depth of Sheol; You*ln heard my voice.
For*ln You had cast me into the deep, Into*ln the heart of the seas, And*ln the current engulfed me. All*ln Your breakers and billows passed over me.
So*ln I said, ‘I have been expelled from Your sight. Nevertheless*ln I will look again toward Your holy temple.’
Water*ln encompassed me to the point of death. The*ln great deep engulfed me, Weeds*ln were wrapped around my head.
I*ln descended to the roots of the mountains. The*ln earth with its bars was*i around me forever, But*ln You have brought up my life from the pit, O Lord*s my God.
While*ln I was fainting away, I*ln remembered the Lord,*s And*ln my prayer came to You, Into*ln Your holy temple.
Those*ln who regard vain idols Forsake*ln their faithfulness,
But*ln I will sacrifice to You With*ln the voice of thanksgiving. That*ln which I have vowed I will pay. Salvation*ln is from the Lord.”*s
Then*p the Lord*s commanded the fish, and it vomited Jonah up onto the dry land.
